Building Block (Monomer): Nucleotides (a phoshate, ribose, and a base- adenine, guanine, thymine, or cytosine)
Nucleotides (a phoshate, ribose, and a base- adenine, guanine, Uracil, or cytosine)
unlike the other macromolecules, lipids are not defined by chemical Structure. Lipids are any organic nonpolar molecule.
Joining Bond: Some lipids are held together by ester bonds; some are huge aggregates of small molecules held together by hydrophobic interactions.
